section.title: Status
section.para: SwiProlog-C++ isn't finished yet. It is in a proceded state, and as far as it goes, is tested and mostly documented. It also should be quite mature and usable, since a lot of thought and reconsideration has gone into it. However, some things remain to be done. And it hasn't been in much usage yet.

listitem.para: Null bytes in atoms and Prolog strings aren't considered.
The main() function must be in the C++ part of the program.
Converting terms to strings should be done in such a way, that the strings are valid Prolog expressions (like write(..., [quoted(true)])).
Exceptions should conform to the ISO standard.
The documentation of how to write foreign predicates has not yet been written. See the test program for some examples.
